ygData.subject: RE: Question about experience penalty (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... ???  What you describe is exactly what I saw. He was barely 31 and lost about a quarter bubble into 30 (I ll assume he lost less than me due to class/race
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 3 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> Wow, that's exactly the opposite of what we saw. He died when barely 31 and
> was down about a quarter bubble in 30. When he died when barely 30 he
> couldn't see any missing xp at 29 and one kill dinged him back to 30.

??? What you describe is exactly what I saw.

He was barely 31 and lost about a quarter bubble into 30 (I'll
assume he lost less than me due to class/race differences).
That tells you a level 31 death costs (for him) a bit more
than quarter of a level 30 bubble.

When he died "barely" 30, he lost almost nothing into 29.
That tell syou a level 30 death costs (for him) so little of a
level 30 bubble that he considered himself "barely" into it.

Therefore, a level 31 death costs (for him) a quarter level 30
bubble, while a level 30 death costs a smidgeon of a level 30
bubble. So a level 31 death takes away more exp than a level
30 death, just like I saw.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
